This is a great puzzle game for both single player and multiplayer formats. The single player has a great story and the progression of the challenge in the levels is fair and engaging. The physics and mechanics are where this game shines and it gives you different ways to work out solutions. Multiplayer is even more fun in my opinion. It's a lot of fun to work together and even mess with your friends while playing, resulting in some really entertaining moments.

Amazing game. Truly defines the puzzle genre, while acting as a great sequel to portal. Read the end for a TL:DR.

Campaign is flawless. It offers a more in-depth journey through aperture that the first game could never accomplish with the original source engine. Campaign characters: Lovable, Exciting, and not annoying. One thing that games forget to do is make their characters good. This game does that in just the right way that it feels like you've built a connection to the characters. Puzzles are easy once you've mastered them, (as I have) but harder once you first play through the game.

Co-op: Amazing. Taking place after the events of the singleplayer campaign, you and your friend (maybe someone who's played the campaign before), can have a really fun time playing. Level editor: Easy and fun to use. I really enjoy building levels for this game, and it shows based on how many I've made. You can also use the hammer editor to build more in-depth and custom levels, but if you are new to level design and want something simple to start you out, this game is for you.

Community levels: Sometimes fun, sometimes boring. You never really know what you're going to get with a level from the workshop. It could be either be a masterpiece made with the hammer editor, or a test chamber made by a 5 year old who thought walking to the exit without having a puzzle was hard. There are also co-op community levels that can yet again be played with your buddy! If you and your partner had a really fun time playing, then you'll probably enjoy working together to beat community levels. Of course you still never know what you're gonna get.

Community mods or 6 part levels: These just add more game that you would want to replay. There are some really good standalone free mods on the steam shop right now if you want to pick them up. Some really good steam mods: Portal stories: Mel, Aperture Tag: The Paint Gun Testing Inititive, Thinking with Time Machine. Here is a list of some 6-part levels that I would personally recommend: Wheatley's Unscientific Tests, Minecraft in Portal 2, COSMOGNY and many more.

Only bad point in this game: There are co-op cosmetics that are not required but still act as in-app purchases if you are so inclined to buy them. The entire store is only about 10 dollars which kinda balances it out though.

TL:DR: Campaign is really good. Co-op is really fun. Level editor is a excellent introduction to level design. Community levels you really don't know what you're gonna get. (Played 6 hours of custom levels today and I wanted to die at the end) Includes Co-op community levels so you and your partner can want to die together. (Sarcasm)

FINAL REVIEW: Finally, right? 8/10 Valve, you've knocked it out of the park once again. Hopefully Half life: Alyx will bring us the same experience.

Один раз был у знакомого в гостях и сильно срать так захотелось, что аж скрутило всего, а в это врем в туалете его мамаша восседала и обсасывала рыбью голову, поехавшая жрет в туалете, ну да ладно. Так пришлось бежать в ванную, складировать свой анальный хабар прямо в лоно ванной я не решился, а порыска и нашел пакетик, надристал знатной подливой пол спасительного пакета, завязал, а выкинуть без палева некуда было, ну я и закинул его под ванную. Потом и забыл об этом. А через 2 недели, этот знакомый мне рассказывает, что приглашал сантехника раковину чинить и трубу менять, а после него обнаружил носом неистовое смердение, искал искал, и заглянул за ванную, а там надорванный пакетик с перебродившим адским месивом, видимо сантехник случайно задел и порвал пакет. Тут то он сразу понял, что проклятый сантех подложил ему мину и пошел его искать, нашел и кинул в рожу заветный пакет с дьявольской жижой, а сантехник в свою очередь дал ему живительных пи3дюлей, вот так они валялись в говне минут пять. Кто прав, кто виноват, а знакомый проклинает сантехника, я же в свою очередь когда его слушал, то припустил в штаны от смеха. Такие дела

I will be honest with you, as the HL fan, to me Portal 1 dont really get my attention due to the slow-pace gameplay and only have some kind of half-ass foes like a turrets or the rocket launcher!  So i dont even bother to Portal 2 in a long time even though i owned the game fo such a long time ! But then the Corona hit me hard, stay at home all day, what else can i do beside clearing my Steam's back-log, and here come Portal 2: 

The game is way superior in every single ways compare to Portal 1. I like its atmosphere, its story and most of all the characters! Having Glados and Wheatly as a companion make me dont feel lonely anymore! The humors is also on point, the level designs and the new mechanics are all interesting! And i have to say, this game is ...well... better than HL2 (imo) 

So yeah,now you know how good this game is =)

This is one of my favorite puzzle games, if not number 1. The story introduces a number of new mechanics and merges them together to make interesting challenges. Also the community levels are constantly being expanded and reworked even though the game is quite old.
